serializers¶

class Projects.API.serializers.ProjectSerializer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer class for the Project model.

This class is used to serialize and deserialize Project instances into Python datatypes. It inherits from Django Rest Framework’s ModelSerializer.

Parameters:

serializers.ModelSerializer (rest_framework.serializers.ModelSerializer) – Base class for model serializers.

Variables:

  • members (rest_framework.serializers.SlugRelatedField) – A field that represents the members of the project. It uses a SlugRelatedField to represent the members by their email.

  • Meta (class) – A class that contains metadata for the serializer.

None()¶

  • fields (str) – The fields to include in the serialized representation.

models¶

class Projects.models.Project_DBTable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Model representing a project.

\*\*project_name

The project name (max of 100 chars).

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*project_description

A detailed description of the project.

Type:

models.TextField**

\*\*participants

The participants of the project.

Type:

models.ManyToMany**

\*\*image

The image of the project.

Type:

models.ImageField**

\*\*owner

The owner of the project.

Type:

models.ForeignKey**

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

asset_dbtable_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

created_at¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

image¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

members¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

modified¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
owner¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

owner_id¶
project_description¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

project_name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user_has_created¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.
